publicationStmt.authority: AHRC funded research project (2004-2009) centred on London, British Library, Harley MS 4431, the collection of her works prepared by Christine de Pizan and presented by her to Queen Isabeau of France early in 1414. Contact Charlie.Mansfield@ ed.ac.uk

div9.div4: The Complainte is introduced by a miniature and a rubric. There is a complete set of running titles, save that the title on fol. 57r has been almost entirely cropped by the binder.

The poem is made up of 15 seizains, rhyming a10a10a10b4b10b10b10c4c10c10c10d4d10d10d10e4e10e10e10f4 etc. The metrical structure is identical to that of the other two Complaintes in the Queen's MS: Item 10 (Une Complainte Amoureuse), and the conclusion of Item 18 (Le Livre du Duc des Vrais Amans).

The opening line of Stanza 1 is set off by a champie initial and a border. The plan that each of the other stanzas should be introduced by a paragraph mark was not fully implemented. Only six were executed, before Stanzas 7 and 11-15; the marginal instructions left before Stanzas 2-6 and 8-10 were overlooked. This edition makes good these oversights and thus contains a complete set of paragraph marks.

There is no obvious reason for the one blank line, which is found halfway through Stanza 1. With that exception, the stanzas are copied without a break. In this edition a blank line has been left after each stanza, mirroring the layout of the other two Complaintes.
